subject: Parenting
title: Critical Periods
description: A short lesson to help you apply Critical Periods.

hook.text: Children who don't hear language before age five rarely develop fluent speech.

buildup.text: Critical periods are windows when the brain is uniquely ready to learn specific skills.

discovery.text: Vision, language, and emotional regulation each have their own critical window.

twist.text: Miss the window and the brain repurposes those neurons for something else entirely.

climax.text: Babies born with cataracts need surgery within months or the visual cortex rewires forever.

punchline.text: Some doors close on a biological schedule.

quiz.question: What happens if a critical period is missed?
